member.summary:
Type of resource referenced
Required field

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.Firewalls.Rule.DestinationIps
member.summary: List of permitted IPv4/IPv6 addresses in CIDR notation. Use 0.0.0.0/0 to allow all IPv4 addresses and ::/0 to allow all IPv6 addresses. You can specify 100 CIDRs at most.

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.Firewalls.Rule.Direction
member.summary:
Select traffic direction on which rule should be applied. Use source_ips for direction in and destination_ips for direction out.
Required field

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.Firewalls.Rule.Port
member.summary: Port or port range to which traffic will be allowed, only applicable for protocols TCP and UDP. A port range can be specified by separating two ports with a dash, e.g 1024-5000

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.Firewalls.Rule.Protocol
member.summary:
Type of traffic to allow
Required field

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.Firewalls.Rule.SourceIps
member.summary: List of permitted IPv4/IPv6 addresses in CIDR notation. Use 0.0.0.0/0 to allow all IPv4 addresses and ::/0 to allow all IPv6 addresses. You can specify 100 CIDRs at most.

member.summary: Additional configuration for protocol http

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.LoadBalancers.HealthChecks.HealthCheck.Interval
member.summary:
Time interval in seconds health checks are performed
Required field

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.LoadBalancers.HealthChecks.HealthCheck.Port
member.summary:
Port the health check will be performed on
Required field

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.LoadBalancers.HealthChecks.HealthCheck.Protocol
member.summary:
Type of the health check
Required field

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.LoadBalancers.HealthChecks.HealthCheck.Retries
member.summary:
Unsuccessful retries needed until a target is considered unhealthy; an unhealthy target needs the same number of successful retries to become healthy again
Required field

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.LoadBalancers.HealthChecks.HealthCheck.Timeout
member.summary:
Time in seconds after an attempt is considered a timeout
Required field

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.LoadBalancers.HealthChecks.HealthCheckHttpCfg.Domain
member.summary: Host header to send in the HTTP request. May not contain spaces, percent or backslash symbols. Can be null, in that case no host header is sent.

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.LoadBalancers.HealthChecks.HealthCheckHttpCfg.Path
member.summary: HTTP path to use for health checks

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.LoadBalancers.HealthChecks.HealthCheckHttpCfg.Response
member.summary: String that must be contained in HTTP response in order to pass the health check

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.LoadBalancers.HealthChecks.HealthCheckHttpCfg.StatusCodes
member.summary: List of returned HTTP status codes in order to pass the health check. Supports the wildcards ? for exactly one character and * for multiple ones. The default is to pass the health check for any status code between 2?? and 3??.

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.LoadBalancers.HealthChecks.HealthCheckHttpCfg.TLS
member.summary: Use HTTPS for health check

Name of the cookie used for sticky sessions.

member.summary: Redirect HTTP requests to HTTPS. Only available if protocol is "https". Default false

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.LoadBalancers.Targets.LoadBalancerTarget.IP
member.summary: IP targets where the traffic should be routed through. It is only possible to use the (Public or vSwitch) IPs of Hetzner Online Root Servers belonging to the project owner. IPs belonging to other users are blocked. Additionally IPs belonging to services provided by Hetzner Cloud (Servers, Load Balancers, ...) are blocked as well.

member.summary: Type of the resource

member.summary: IPv4 prefix of the whole Network

member.summary: Array of IDs of Load Balancers attached to this Network

member.summary: Protection configuration for the Network

member.summary: Array of routes set in this Network

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.Network.Servers
member.summary: Array of IDs of Servers attached to this Network

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.Network.Subnets
member.summary: Array subnets allocated in this Network

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.Networks.Route.Destination
member.summary:
Destination network or host of this route. Must not overlap with an existing ip_range in any subnets or with any destinations in other routes or with the first IP of the networks ip_range or with 172.31.1.1. Must be one of the private IPv4 ranges of RFC1918.
Required field

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.Networks.Route.Gateway
member.summary:
Gateway for the route. Cannot be the first IP of the networks ip_range and also cannot be 172.31.1.1 as this IP is being used as a gateway for the public network interface of Servers.
Required field

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.Networks.Subnet.Gateway
member.summary:
Gateway for Servers attached to this subnet. For subnets of type Server this is always the first IP of the network IP range.
Not used when creating a subnet

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.Networks.Subnet.IpRange
member.summary: Range to allocate IPs from. Must be a Subnet of the ip_range of the parent network object and must not overlap with any other subnets or with any destinations in routes. Minimum Network size is /30. We suggest that you pick a bigger Network with a /24 netmask.

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.Networks.Subnet.NetworkZone
member.summary:
Name of Network zone. Currently eu-central is the only available zone.
Required field

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.Networks.Subnet.Type
member.summary:
Type of Subnetwork
Required field

member.name: T:hcloud_api.Models.Objects.Networks.SubnetType
member.summary: Type of Subnetwork

Required field

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Requests.Networks.CreateNetworkRequest.IpRange
member.summary:
IP range of the whole network which must span all included subnets. Must be one of the private IPv4 ranges of RFC1918. Minimum network size is /24. We highly recommend that you pick a larger network with a /16 netmask.
Required field

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Requests.Networks.CreateNetworkRequest.Labels
member.summary: User-defined labels

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Requests.Networks.CreateNetworkRequest.Routes
member.summary: Array of routes set in this network. The destination of the route must be one of the private IPv4 ranges of RFC1918. The gateway must be a subnet/IP of the ip_range of the network object. The destination must not overlap with an existing ip_range in any subnets or with any destinations in other routes or with the first IP of the networks ip_range or with 172.31.1.1. The gateway cannot be the first IP of the networks ip_range and also cannot be 172.31.1.1.

member.name: P:hcloud_api.Models.Requests.Networks.CreateNetworkRequest.Subnets
member.summary: Array subnets allocated in this Network

member.name: M:hcloud_api.Services.IHCloudService.UpdateServer(hcloud_api.Models.Objects.Server)
member.summary: Updates a Server. You can update a Servers name and a Servers labels. Please note that Server names must be unique per Project and valid hostnames as per RFC 1123 (i.e. may only contain letters, digits, periods, and dashes). Also note that when updating labels, the Servers current set of labels will be replaced with the labels provided in the request body. So, for example, if you want to add a new label, you have to provide all existing labels plus the new label in the request body.
member.exception: If an error field is present in the response from the server

member.name: M:hcloud_api.Services.IHCloudService.UpdateServer(System.Int32,hcloud_api.Models.Requests.Servers.UpdateServerRequest)
member.summary: Updates a Server. You can update a Servers name and a Servers labels. Please note that Server names must be unique per Project and valid hostnames as per RFC 1123 (i.e. may only contain letters, digits, periods, and dashes). Also note that when updating labels, the Servers current set of labels will be replaced with the labels provided in the request body. So, for example, if you want to add a new label, you have to provide all existing labels plus the new label in the request body.
member.exception: If an error field is present in the response from the server

member.name: M:hcloud_api.Services.IHCloudService.CreateNetwork(hcloud_api.Models.Requests.Networks.CreateNetworkRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a network with the specified ip_range.
You may specify one or more subnets.You can also add more Subnets later by using the add subnet action.If you do not specify an ip_range in the subnet we will automatically pick the first available /24 range for you.
You may specify one or more routes in routes.You can also add more routes later by using the add route action.
member.exception: If an error field is present in the response from the server

member.summary: Deletes a network. If there are Servers attached they will be detached in the background.
